goal.core.program.actions

Class UserSpecOrModuleCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.actions.Action
        • goal.core.program.actions.UserSpecOrModuleCall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class UserSpecOrModuleCall
extends Action
    Action used for parsing purposes only. Used because at the parsing time it cannot yet be determined whether the parsed object should be resolved to either a user-specified action or to a focus action (module invocation).
    This 'action' is replaced during validation of the agent program by a proper action.
    A UserOrFocusAction cannot be executed.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserSpecOrModuleCall

        public UserSpecOrModuleCall(java.lang.String name,
                    java.util.List<Term> parameters,
                    InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates an action that can either be a ModuleCallAction or a UserSpecAction.

        Method calls will result in an UnsupportedOperationException with the following exceptions:

        • Action.getName()
        • getParameters()
        • getFreeVar()
        • getRule()
        • setRule(Rule)
        • toString()

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the action.
        parameters - The parameters of the action.
        source - The source code location of this action, if available; null otherwise.

      • getPrecondition

        public MentalStateCond getPrecondition(KRlanguage language)
        Description copied from class: Action
        Returns the precondition for this Action. The action is applicable only if the MentalStateCond has at least one solution.

        Does not support multiple specifications for actions.

        Specified by:
        getPrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        language - The KR language that is used for representing the action's precondition.
        Returns:
        A MentalStateCond that represents the action's precondition; or null if the precondition of the action does not depend on the agent's MentalState.

      • applySubst

        public Action applySubst(Substitution subst)
        Description copied from class: Action
        Creates a new Action by applying the Substitution to it, i.e. by replacing any free variables in the action's parameters that also occur in the substitution by the corresponding terms.
        Specified by:
        applySubst in class Action
        Parameters:
        subst - The substitution to apply
        Returns:
        Instantiated action which is the result of applying the substitution to this action.

      • evaluatePrecondition

        public UserSpecOrModuleCall evaluatePrecondition(MentalState mentalState,
                                        Debugger debugger,
                                        boolean last)
        Description copied from class: Action
        Checks whether the precondition of this Action holds and, if this is the case, returns the action selected for execution.
        Specified by:
        evaluatePrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The MentalState in which the precondition is evaluated.
        debugger - The current debugger
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        The action that is selected for execution if the precondition holds; null otherwise.
